data.chText: 布道，讲道（尤指教堂中礼拜时）
data.enText: to give a religious talk in a public place, especially in a church during a service

data.chText: 她向会众宣讲宽恕的道理。
data.enText: She preached to the congregation about forgiveness.

data.chText: 牧师讲道时用了亡羊的比喻。
data.enText: The minister preached a sermon on the parable of the lost sheep.

data.chText: 宣传，宣扬，宣讲（教义、生活方式、体制等）
data.enText: to tell people about a particular religion, way of life, system, etc. in order to persuade them to accept it
to preach the word of God

data.chText: 他向我们宣扬资本主义的优点。
data.enText: He preached the virtues of capitalism to us.

data.chText: 她宣扬了健康生活的好处。
data.enText: She preached about the benefits of a healthy lifestyle.
to give sb advice on moral standards, behaviour, etc., especially in a way that they find annoying or boring

data.chText: 很抱歉，我并没有说教的意思。
data.enText: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to preach.

data.chText: 向教徒宣教；教读书人写大字
data.enText: to speak to people in support of views that they already hold

data.chText: 身体力行；躬行所言；言行一致
data.enText: to do the things yourself that you tell other people to do

means: 布道，讲道(尤指教堂中礼拜时)
宣传，宣扬，宣讲(教义、生活方式、体制等)

data.chText: 向教徒宣教；教读书人写大字
data.enText: to speak to people in support of views that they already hold

data.chText: 身体力行；躬行所言；言行一致
data.enText: to do the things yourself that you tell other people to do

tr: speak, plead, or argue in favor of
example: The doctor advocated a smoking ban in the entire house
The minister is not preaching this Sunday

value.def: When a member of the clergy preaches a sermon, he or she gives a talk on a religious or moral subject during a religious service.

example.ex: At High Mass the priest preached a sermon on the devil...
example.tran: 牧师在大弥撒上布道驱邪。

example.ex: The bishop preached to a crowd of several hundred local people...
example.tran: 主教向当地聚集的数百人布道。

example.ex: He denounced the decision to invite his fellow archbishop to preach.
example.tran: 他痛斥了邀请其他大主教同仁布道的决定。

value.def: When people preach a belief or a course of action, they try to persuade other people to accept the belief or to take the course of action.

example.ex: The Prime Minister said he was trying to preach peace and tolerance to his people...
example.tran: 首相表示他在竭力向他的人民宣传和平和宽容。

example.ex: Health experts are now preaching that even a little exercise is far better than none at all...
example.tran: 现在健康专家都在宣扬，即使是少量的运动也远比根本不运动好得多。

example.ex: For many years I have preached against war.
example.tran: 我多年来都在进行反战宣传。

value.def: If someone gives you advice in a very serious, boring way, you can say that they are preaching at you.

example.tran: 他大喊道：“不要对我说教。”

value.tran: 说教；唠叨；不胜其烦地劝诫

value.def: If you say that someone practises what they preach, you mean that they behave in the way that they encourage other people to behave in.

example.ex: He ought to practise what he preaches.

value.tran: 以身作则；身体力行；躬行己说

value.def: If you say that someone is preaching to the converted, you mean that they are wasting their time because they are trying to persuade people to think or believe in things that they already think or believe in.
value.tran: 向教徒传道（表示向已经接受某种思想的人宣传这种思想）
